title: Oral Propranolol for Treatment of Pediatric Capillary Hemangiomas
patient: This patient was a three-month-old female infant with a massive lesion on the left side of her face which included the eye and ear. Ulceration of the lesion had led to upper lid margin necrosis and ptosis with the risk of deprivation amblyopia. She was treated with oral propranolol and the lesion regressed to nearly half of its visible size over one month. After one year, propranolol was tapered over a period of 2-3 weeks ().
